Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Value, features can't be beat
Cons: Wish power plug was micro usb
In my household, we have an iPad, and iPad 2 and now the Asus tablet (mine). I really like it...Gorilla glass was a definite for me, and after a month or so of throwing it in a briefcase without a cover, it still looks great. I read other reviews where fingerprints seem to show up easier than an iPad, and I think that might be true. If you want an android tablet (I won't go into android vs apple os), this is a great product.
Pros - Great price. Not so worried about losing/breaking/scratching - Nice weight, feels comparable to ipad2 - Polaris Office included for free. Awesome. - Textured back...easy to hold and nice color - Nice screen, colors are good, I don't have any dead spots. ... >- Speaker quality was a nice surprise
Cons - Seems to collect fingerprints/smudges easy. Wiping often (always a good practice :)) - Lint tends to collect in crack b/t bezel and screen. Not a big deal. - Camera quality is decent, but not great, but who takes pictures with a tablet - Wish it wasn't a proprietary power plug. This one feels a little flimsy (where jack attaches to tablet), and if it goes, will be a pain to replace. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: B-E-A-Utiful! Much better than the iPad!
Item.Review: Okay, where to begin? This is an amazing piece of technology and before I say anything else, you should buy it. It literally has too many pros for me to list and just a few cons that can be easily forgotten about. I'll get started...Pros-The screen is BRILLIANT! Better than the iPad, and that is no lie! It has a super crisp resolution and the ips technology gives it amazing viewing angles and colors pop out at you!-The battery life is super long! Just as long as the iPad. I'm comparing this to the iPad so much because that's its main rival, considering the transformer is the second best selling tablet in the world second only to the iPad. Anyway battery life is easily 7-8 hours with heavy usage on wifi. With the dock it jumps up to over 13 hours!-Android OS is super user friendly! You woul ... dn't believe it unless you saw it. And not to mention multitasking is true multitasking. With the press of a button it shows all of the recent apps and a box with exactly what you were doing in that app. Just tap and go.-Build quality is great too! Not perfect, but very very good. The back feels nice even though it is plastic. The screen glass feels very solid and it is still in perfect condition even though I have accidently dropped my phone on to it a few times....oops-Size and weight is pretty good too! Not quite as good as the iPad, but close! And the tapered edges make it feel like it really is as thin as the iPad. My friend actually picked up and he said woah that's so much lighter than my ipad! Then he asked how much it costed. I told him only [$] for 16gb (8gb base and 16gb micro sd expanstion). He expected it to cost one or two hundred more!-Apps are very readily available. The Android Market is rapidly growing and there is a new feature on tablets so that every single available app runs perfectly on tablets. You have the entire market at your disposal.-Built in apps are very good! The browser especially. It's super fast and easy to use!-The camera isn't anything super, but it is very good for a tablet. There aren't many features however picture quality is decent and HD videos come out looking crisp and smooth, without dropping any frames. This problem was fixed in the 3.1 update.Okay there is so much more to the pros but my fingers are starting to hurt, so I'll go to the few cons quickly.-Stock keyboard lags in browser...but that's easily fixed by downloading a new keyboard. Since Android is open-sourced, it is very easy to install and use a new one of your choice.-Speaker quality is good but it is fairly quiet. This is easily solved by using headphones.-The operating system OCCASIONALLY crashes..and by that I mean once every 2-3 months. I've had my transformer for more than 3 months and it has crashed on me only twice..and both happened within 15 minutes doing the same thing, but it hasn't happened since.Well that about wraps it up. I really hope this helps you in your choice. To me and many others, including my dad who owns an ipad, this is the best tablet around. Yes, my dad who owns an iPad prefers my tablet which cost hundreds less over his. I would highly recommend this tablet to anyone and everyone! expand » « collapse

Recently my tablet started losing its charge rapidly. At the same time, the tablet stopped accepting a charge as well. I went online for customer service. First, I had to re-register my tablet, only to have to spend over 30 minutes filling out and re-filling out the product registration page because ASUS's servers kept timing out. Next, I filled out a customer service request form. Instead of being able to import the information I inputted into the registration page, I had to fill the entire form out again!! After almost a week I received a courteous form email giving me some generic suggestions (i.e., charge your tablet, even though my primary complaint was that it wouldn't accept a charge).
I was told t ... hat if the suggestions didn't help, I could reply with an email stating the problem (again), along with my product and personal information (wow, 3 times I've had to provide the serial number! Finally, after 2 weeks of this nonsense, I have a paper form in front of me, asking me to describe the problem one.more.time. What a terrible experience. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Android tablet at a great price!
Item.Review: The Asus Transformer is an excellent lower priced alternative to the other Android Honeycomb based tablets available now. Internally it is basically the same as all the other Android tablets out now with an NVIDIA Tegra 2 CPU and 16GB of internal memory. Unlike many other tablets, the Transformer has an IPS screen, like the iPad2, that allows for viewing at fairly sharp angles. It also has a MiniSD card slot on the side that will allow you to bump up the storage. I bought a 16GB MiniSD card and now 32GB of storage. That being said the Transformer runs fast and smooth. Currently the app selection in the Android market is not overwhelming but the apps that are designed for tablets really look stunning. Some of the 3D games really show off the power of the tablet and potential of Honeyco ... mb. The selection will grow as time passes and will get better. The build is solid and sturdy, yes it has a plastic back but it doesn't diminish the overall feel. The weight is manageable, I just wouldn't use it with my arms outstretched all day. It has both front and rear cameras, the rear camera takes a decent picture but the video quality could be much better. (Maybe a software patch could improve it?) Then again I wasn't buying it for the cameras; it is very awkward holding one of these tablets up to try and snap a picture. Being able to video chat, Skype, etc. is a nice plus. The battery life is fantastic. I can use the tablet all day with WiFi on and not have to plug it in. Even with GPS and Bluetooth on it will run for most of the day. On standby it can sit overnight and only lose about 2-3% of the battery. My measurements are far from scientific, the important part is I have been able to use the tablet when I want and not worry about the power running out. Asus includes some apps of their own and one that really stands out is the File Manager. It allows you access to the internal storage as well as the MiniSD card so you can move, copy and delete files on both. (This really should be a standard Android feature) The other Asus apps are standard fare, but nothing special. I prefer the Gmail app over the Asus mail app, DropBox over the Asus MyCloud app, Nook over MyBooks and lastly the Asus MyNet app for video, music & pics is buggy. Once I added the VLC media player it plays videos with ease and the stock Android music app is great. The included YouTube app is very good as well but I don't if it is an Asus app or a standard Android app. Also I have tried the Asus web browser as well as Firefox and Opera. I found Opera to be the best of the 3 but that is probably a personal preference as all 3 were capable. Overall I am very satisfied with the Asus Transformer. For checking email, keeping up with Twitter & news feeds, web surfing, eReading, etc. it does all with ease. You really can't beat it for the price and having the ability to expand the storage. The ability to add the keyboard dock and turn the Transformer into a decent netbook is a plus and why it is named the Transformer. I do not have the keyboard so I can't comment on it but on the surface it is a promising idea. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Fantastic tablet, with latest Android OS
Item.Review: I use this tablet every day for web browsing, watching MP4 movies, listening to MP3 music, remote control of my home theater PC, and more. The Android 3.1 OS and set of apps included by Asus are quite useful, and the Android Market has tons of additional apps. The included Google Maps has already evolved to let you carry a static map for when you don't have wi-fi. I love the resolution, brightness and touch response of the display (same technology as the iPad 2). I love the dual-core speed. I love the battery life. I love the memory expandability, especially with the keyboard dock that also doubles the battery life and allows USB hard drive and connections. I love the looks, the design and construction of the system, except for the speakers (to enjoy sound tracks you need headphones or ext ... ernal speakers). Not the fault of Asus, but USB CD/DVD drives aren't recognized by Android at this time, and Netflix hasn't blessed this tablet with their streaming software yet. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: A shakey step in the right direction.
Item.Review:
Pros: Best price of the higher end tablets. Well thought out design.
Cons: Still expensive. Light bleed issues. The charge cable is too short. The cameras and mic stink.
I purchased this a month ago because it was the lowest priced tablet of the higher end duo core tablets; honeycomb or otherwise. This is the first tablet I have ever owned, I have never used an apple product and I do not own a smart phone. I do have the dock and it is quite good but I'll leave the details to another review.
Load times are short and the folder based file system is easy to navigate. Installing and uninstalling apps is quick and simple. The home screen is customizable with some useful widgets including calendar, weather and music players. It has a long battery life, requiring a charge abo ... ut once a day sans dock. I've also purchased a micro SD card specifically to add 32 gb of storage.
The display is quite beautiful with excellent viewing angles. The 1280x 800 display is perfect for watching 720p video content. The glass is also very resilient; resisting frequent cleaning due to all the sweat and grime from my not so hygienic hands and occasional sneezes. The textured back is easy to grip and has remained surprisingly clean despite myself. It is silent and quiet making it easy to use for hours on end.
Included bundled apps are not just bloatware for once. My favorite is the remote desktop app MyCloud (a specifically customized version of Splashtop Remote) which can turn the tablet into a wireless touchscreen monitor for a mac or PC. I use it on my 4 year old PC to open 720p mkv and other problematic files over a wireless G network all over my house with it. Most other programs I tried can barely handle ordinary web browsing.
Unfortunately, I do have a number of issues with the device, most importantly, light leak issues. My display has two fingernail sized light leaks, one on the home button and one near the clock. They are noticeable even at the lowest setting.
Other minor hardware issues I have include, the short 3 foot long charging cable and lack of a USB port without the dock. The cameras are both poor and the microphone is pathetically weak. ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Lightning fast and a great price!
Item.Review:
Pros: Greased lightning! Comfortable to hold

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Functions great, worth the price, feels solid.
Cons: Tech support confusing even for a tech guy, sometimes stays powered on.
Quick version:
Solid product. Great right out of the box. Screen is slick, response is solid, and the amount of things I can do with it is amazing. 9 hour battery life by itself (up to 20 with docking station - and the fact it has a docking station!) just a very cool device.
My main complaints is that the auto-updater has never worked. I'm a tech guy by hobby and think of myself as relatively savvy, but one trip to the Asus website to manually update the software myself and I was in technical hell, starting to wonder if the device was broken. Eventually I figured it out but still frustrating. Some quick tips:
Holding down powe ... r button for 10 seconds restarts the system. If you're trying to turn it on and it does literally nothing, it's not broken, don't panic. A program may have frozen and now your power button appears to do nothing. Hold down power for 10 seconds, it will reset.
Holding down the power button and the volume up button for 10 seconds will give you a boot menu to restore it if you accidentally mess something up. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Speed, picture quality, optional docking station
Cons: Low volume from speakers, non-standard power plug
A good tablet overall. Power cord annoys me as it's not a normal plug going in to the unit itself, so likely a pain to find a replacement for. Also, the USB charging cable won't charge off PC unless in sleep mode. Finally, speakers could be louder. Just sitting as my desk in the office I can barely hear Netflix at full volume. That said, it responds fast, easy to figure out and use, and with an Android ICS OS it's easy to find apps and programs.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything!
Cons: File manager / structure isn't really friendly but I'm sure there's an app for that
Full feature tablet for a great price. I'm not sorry I made this purchase! I have had the ASUS transformer TF101 for about 2 months now. I haven't really found anything I can't do with it. I use it mainly for browsing the web, watching movies, checking email and staying connected with my social media sites. It is the perfect size for reading books and watching Netflix while relaxing in bed. The automatic firmware update to Ice Cream Sandwich (Android 4.0) happened about a month ago. March 2012. There didn't appear to be many great improvements over 3.2, but some noticeable changes and improvements. I am really satisfied with this tablet and have not had but one issue, a ... nd that had to do with a new Belkin N router I installed for wireless networking in my home. For some reason, when I installed the router, my social media and Netflix, ceased to function. After several calls to ASUS and Netflix the resolve was to send the tablet in for repair at ASUS. They even offered to pay shipping both ways. I was one day away from mailing it off when I noticed that it worked everywhere but at my home. Again I called Belkin and they figured out that my router settings needed to be changed and that solved the issue. There was no issue with the tablet. Through this process, ASUS was very helpful with my issues and for customer service, with me, they rated top-notch! I would definitely recommend this tablet above all others that I researched, including that i-thing. I spent a good month comparing and reviewing many brands and decided that the ASUS TF101 was what I wanted and was the best deal for the $400 price. I will now be investing in the optional docking station which will basically turn it into a netbook. I love it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Just about everything!
Cons: Because its an Android device some apps are still "iffy".
After lots of research I purchased this tablet despite the fact the "Prime" had just come out. What I purchased turned out to be exactly what I expected and more. It has all the features of the "expensive" brands without the price. Is it sturdy? First week I accidentally left it on the roof of my car and it fell off as I turned a corner in the parking lot. Small scratch on corner. It did have the Targus leather case on it, however its not an Otterbox or Ballistic type case. No cracks on screen, all functions worked. Battery life is amazingly long, even with video and HDMI output to tv. Perfect screen size for web browsing and movie watching in bed or hotel room if you are too lazy to ... hook it up to tv. I also purchased the Logitech bluetooth keyboard and this thing just got 10X better! Replying to e-mails is easy as is using Word (android version). I really have no solid complaints. Its just as fast as anything else out there, save the "Prime". To be honest, even some of my die hard IPad people are interested simply in the fact that I can upgrade the memory using an SD card. I would buy again! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Attractive Design; Portable; Durable; Microsoft Office; Great Interface; Fun; Easy to Use
Cons: none
I am a 13 year old 8th Grader, but please don't underestimate my thoughts. I am a snowboarder and I edit my video footage with Sony Vegas Pro and Adobe After Effects, and I also fix our computers with anything from a Blue Screen of Death to cleaning up space on the hard drive so I am plenty technologically inclined. Now onto the actual review: This is hands down the best tablet I have ever used (and I have tested plenty of other tablets including both iPad's). It's interface is great! The simplicity mixed with the capabilities of what is possible on the tablet is amazing. I use this tablet all the time for school work, watching movies, playing games, and reading books ... plus a ton more. I especially love the app Polaris Office which allows me to type Microsoft Word and make powerpoints and Excel Spreadsheets that I can then transfer to my laptop. The screen resolution is very crisp and the touch interface is very responsive! The processor is amazingly powerful for a tablet! I have played many games such as GTA III and others and not one bit of lag ever seemed to show up! I also love putting my books on it, no matter it being a self-read or for school. The appearance of the tablet itself is sleek and slim and very lightweight. Lastly, I also love the Gorrila Glass this thing has, it is completely unnecessary to buy screen protectors unless you plan on skipping the screen across rocks. I hope you found this helpful and decide to buy one of these for yourself!!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I wish Adobe Flash had been pre-installed. I also wish I had known Java was not compatable. It has only one HDMI port. Keyboard is super responsive & easy to use. Extremely user friendly. Battery holds up well. Really a good buy for the money. Overall really pleased.

Item.Review:

I fully recommend this tablet! It has fulfilled all my needs as a busy college student, and then some. It is sturdy construction, I've knocked it of the counter a couple of times with no damage to it. The touchscreen is ultra responsive and the tablet itself is easy to use even for beginners. The only thing that I wish it had was 4G but I wasn't willing to spend more on a tablet with 4G until I knew if I would enjoy using one. There are plenty of freebie apps available to fit pretty much any need. The gorilla glass has come in very handy since my dogs think they are supposed to step on it whenever possible. Not a scratch, ever. The battery life will get me through a whole day of almost constant use without recharging. This is ... an excellent tablet for anyone looking to see if this type of technology fits into their life. expand » « collapse

Occasionally freezes, minor issues on occasion that do not significantly affect its performance.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:

Cons: Customer support. Charger appears to be defective. Keyboard is so so.
I have the transformer with the key board. Generally I like the tablet but the charger has always been a problem. After three months it stopped charging. Asus customer support is AWFUL. I get new products have problems, but they are unresponsive, difficult to work with, and make you send in the part at your expense. I am sending in my charger and they will take seven business days from receipt to "respond". I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND Asus products for business. The company does not have it's act together when it comes to support. If you can afford to be without your tablet for a month or more, then Asus is probably ok for you.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:

Cons: Still unsure at this point. If I have to write something then the $399 price is not so great.
I bought this tablet for $40 over Black Friday price. My 13 year old loves it and has no complaints when accessing the web or playing games. I am not sure that I would pay $399 for this tablet, but it was a steal at $299. My only issue is that I am unable to connect to my 802.11N network. It connects to 802.11G just fine. I am still researching to see if it is me or t he device.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso

You may not get any other better option at this price tag. You can use the tablet for business and entertainment. The screen is of high-quality and the keyboard of the tablet is nice option. Battery of this tablet is able to give you nine and a half hours. Video playback quality is also very nice large, clear & vivid.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I bought this product as a gift for my boyfriend for his birthday and he just loved it. He uses it for his email and he checks [@] all the time while at home and on the road. Its sleek comfortable to hold. It's easy to use and easy to carry. The speakers work great, its pretty loud for a tablet.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice, solid device, well made. Not an iPad
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice screen, responsive touch, easy to hold, long battery life.
Cons: Not as polished in form or function as the iPad. Apps not consistent.
This is a very good product that functioned well. Google integration is excellent, wi-fi was as fast as other devices on my network. However, it's just not quite as good as my iPad. The camera (both sides) had muted colors, apps are generally not up to Apple quality or consistency. The SD slots look great, but the lack of a file management system makes them almost useless for external storage of documents (may be OK for movies/music). I couldn't get anything to work through the USB slots (memory sticks or other devices) so I'm not sure what purpose they serve. Much more difficult to print from than the iPad!

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Asus Eee Pad Transformer & Optional Keyboard
Item.Review:
Pros: One of the best price concious tablets on the market.
I purchased two of these items during the black Friday sale (day after Thanksgiving) a few months ago. I have also purchased the optional keyboards. What an outstanding value. It is like having a netbook and tablet in one. The battery life is greater than 16 hours. the Tablet and keyboard can use the 32 gb micro-sd cards, that increases the storage capacity to 80 gb. That is greater than any other tablet. The cameras have there limitations, 5 mb rear facing and the 1.5 mb front facing from the perspective of amateur outdoor photographer. The performance is above par, and I love the idea that I don't have to purchase a tablet stand to prop the tablet up when viewing. At times I find the keyboard a bit sluggish which can be o ... vercome by typing a bit slower. The touchpad on the small keyboard, like most laptop keyboards can be sensitive to the occasional tapping from resting the palm of your hands on the edge of the touchpad. You can easily turn off the touchpad when doing extensive typing. The USB ports on the keyboard come in really handy when transferring files from a thumb drive. The viewability of the screen in sunlight is a bit diminished and more than adequate indoors. I have used this at work and other work colleagues have been intrigued with this small package combination. I will probably continue using this tablet for the next few years. This tablet – keyboard combination is quite compact and portable. If you are familiar with Android system from your smartphone, the functionality and downloadable apps are similar.
The only shortfall is I have yet to find a protective cover that will accommodate the tablet and keyboard when they are attached together. I did end up purchasing a Targus IPad tablet case that works well. The case has extra pockets for cell phone, cords, charger, and extra sd cards. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso

I Love this tablet. Setup was easy, battery life is about 8 - 12 hours standby. The storage is easy to upgrade.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: I couldnt be happier with this tablet.
Item.Review:
Pros: Ready out of the box, functions as advertised, decent price when on sale.
Cons: A little bulky
I have had the tablet for three months now and have had a chance to put it through its paces. This tablet will browse the internet without any problems. Some pages load a little slowly but they are few and far between. I did also load a secondary web browser, I was having a little difficulty loading a flash game that i liked to play. Between the two browser, I have yet to find a page that did not load. All flash games included. I have loaded music and movies onto sd cards and played them also. This tablet has taken the place of my iPod when traveling down the raod. With my work, i use microsoft office extensively. While they say you cannot modify documents with the ... tablet, i have managed to download some apps that will allow me to make the changes that I need on the fly. Otherwise, viewing all office docs is a breeze. For christmas I got the docking station. And now I dont consider this to be a tablet, but rather a very functional net book. Not to mention I only charge the battery once every few days. Also with the docking station comes the usb ports and full size sd card slot. If you are a hard core laptop user, I am sure you will not be satisfied, but for the everyday user who is looking for excellent funtions without the bulk of a laptop, then ths tablet is what you are looking for. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso

I did a lot of research on this device before purchasing. It's the best tablet I could find on the market today. It does everything I had hoped for and then some. Battery goes quick, but comes with a plug in power cable so it's not such a big deal. Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: The Transformer transformed nothing for me
Item.Review:
Pros: Build quality and performance
Cons: Serves no purpose
I argued with myself for months about whether or not I should buy one of these things. I have a laptop, an xbox, a digital TV and an android smartphone. Why, therefore, would I need this device that doesn't have a phone and is half the size of my laptop screen (not to mention 1/4 the size of the extra monitor I have hooked into my laptop?
Well, thought I, it would allow me to take notes and stay connected. Except, my laptop does that. This device is 10.1". My laptop is 14". That's not a big difference.
I could watch Netflix wherever and whenever. Except that I can already watch Netflix quite clearly on my smartphone (comes in crystal clear too). I can watch it on my laptop. I can watch it through my xbo ... x and TV, which are right at the foot of my bed. Still not seeing the upside here.
I could read books! Sorry. My smart phone gives me the ability to read books from Kindle, Nook and Google (+ more if I choose). There's no advantage here, and the Transformer is much much heavier than my smart phone for protracted reading. It's rather like a personal exercise system if you have to hold it for more than 20 minutes.
Well, it has a bigger screen and so manipulating things like Google documents and spreadsheets ought to be a lot easier on a screen this size. Nope. The same inability to easily edit spreadsheets that exists with my 4.3" screen smartphone exists with the same software writ large for the tablet. To really do any serious work requires the laptop, I'm afraid.
So, what did I do? I bought the thing anyway.
Now I regret it.
It's not that the device is bad. It works well. The screen is slick. The keyboard docking station very functional. The build quality is great.
It just doesn't serve any purpose - especially at a $647 price point with the keyboard. For that money I could buy a low end laptop and get three or four times the functionality.
So, conclusion: Great product. Completely pointless (as are most tablets, I'm afraid). Give it a phone capability, and ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Versatile tablet at a great price
Item.Review:
Pros: Web Browsing; Operating System; Battery Life; WiFi; Easy To Customize; App Availablity; Screen
We have a variety of tablets around the house - Apple, Archos, Samsung, and Asus. The iPad was the first we got, and it is the simplest device. Unfortunately, it is too simple for my tastes, though Apple has started to add some badly needed Android features with their recent offerings.
The next were the Archos 70 and Samsung Galaxy Tab. The Archos is pretty clunky, definitely targeted to the "deep geek" market, as it takes a lot of care and feeding. The Samsung was nice, but a too expensive for what you get, close to the iPad in price.
The Transformer was a revelation to me - solidly constructed, well integrated, and brilliantly designed at a fair price. Adding the exte ... rnal keyboard transforms the tablet into a netbook, and almost doubles battery life in the process. This is by far the most "sorted-out" tablet (Android or otherwise) that I have used.
Asus adds some "special sauce" to the Transformer software too. For example their MyCloud app not only includes the normal cloud-based storage and backup, but also provides remote desktop access to your home PC. This is very cool, search YouTube for some nice videos demonstrating the feature.
The Transformer is about the only tablet I use on a regular basis. I still use the Archos once in a while, as the 7" form factor makes it handy on occasion. I don't use the Samsung or Apple tablets at all anymore. I plan to sell the Samsung, while it still has some market value left. And I am going give the Apple to my 91-year-old technophobe father for Christmas, where the simplicity and lack of features will be beneficial. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: All I Can Say is WOW!!!
Item.Review: This is my first tablet and I'm totally blown away by what it can do. It's fast. It's easy to use. It's making my laptop obsolete. The Transformer has a stunning display. I have people stop to look/watch when I have HD movies playing. My aging family members are able to see the screen to read or play games perfectly. I had no issues with bleeding or dead pixels. The tablet itself feels sturdy and well made. As soon as I got my paws on it, I was a happy camper. The back is textured so it doesn't slide and the buttons are satisfying to click. This tablet is a regular Speedy Gonzalez. Fast as fast can be. Everything is snappy and instant and I have a TON of widgets and a very complex live wallpaper. Speaking of which, the battery life on this tablet is nothing short of amazing. ... One last note, this tablet will be supported when Ice Cream Sandwich releases. The only real negative is the speaker. It's not very loud and the sound quality is average. Not a huge problem since there is a headphone jack. expand » « collapse

Item.Review:

This tablet is great, somewhat easy to use, the manuel is online but doesn't give you expert moves to us on the tablet. Very lightweight, fast, apps download within 10-15 seconds. You can go from app to app or brower to brower with out ever slowing down. Very responsive no lag that I have experienced yet. Worth the money and the price compared to other tablets makes it worth it even more.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Great tablet, if you get a non-defective unit
Item.Review:
Make sure you buy from a seller with a decent return policy! The older builds have at least one defect (light bleed, creaking bezel, unbalanced speaker sound.) Even though these units are likely out of sale circulation by now, it doesn't hurt to protect yourself. It's easy to figure out which builds to buy, as there is plenty of information available online.
App Availability
Android Market is great! I don't need every app out there, but the ones I was looking for were all available for this tablet.
Design
Had to return two units for unbalanced speaker volume (1st unit) and a squeaking bezel and light bleed (2nd unit). Even though my third unit isn't perfect (light bleed still remains), it is quite acceptable, keeping in mind that the next best Android tablet, in ... my opinion, is $100 more. The fact this tablet accepts microSD tablets is a BIG plus in my book, as I didn't have to shell out extra money for the higher storage capacity tablet.
Durability
Had to return two units for unbalanced speaker volume and a squeaking bezel. Third time was a charm though. expand » « collapse

The screen is bright and clear, the price was great for what you get, the ability to use the micro-sd card was a huge selling point and the entire package was above expectations. The tablet works great and so far no problems, it has even impressed our Ipad friends. I highly recommend this tablet for the battery life, features, speed, capability and the display. Nothing bad to say at all.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Great Tablet Except for One Thing
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Fast; Easy To Use; Powerful; Great color and resolutio; Long Battery Life; Great price
Cons: Heavier than I wanted
This is a great tablet. Fast, easy to use, powerful, long battery life, beautiful color and nice resolution. I enjoyed using it. I returned it because I found it heavy enough so that I could not hold it with one hand for sure and even with two hands my hands got tired after about 30 minutes. It is not nearly as lightweight as an iPad (but, it has Gorilla glass, is more robust, and has more functionality; it's a tradeoff). This is the only tablet I would think of getting at this price point other than an iPad which costs more. It depends what is important to you-- accepting a little more weight or going with a much lighter albeit less p ... owerful (iPad users might take exception to that!) tablet. I'll wait until the android units get lighter or the iPad gets Adobe Flash before I commit to a tablet. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Excellent Tab at an Excellent Price
Item.Review:
Pros: Great price, optional keyboard dock is a huge plus
Cons: Selection of Apps for Tablets on Android Market is still poor. Hopefully that will change.
I researched the current batch of tablets extensively before purchasing and everything pointed to the Asus Eee Pad Transformer as being the best of the Honeycomb bunch. I had no interest in the iPad because I wanted a tab with an "open" OS and that had ports for expandable memory (the Transformer only accepts USB if you purchase the optional keyboard dock, which I plan on doing).
Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with the Transformer. It's easy to use, fast, and looks great. It's still heavy, in my opinion (even though its one of the lighter tabs on the market) but it doesn't bother me too much. The Transformer is a gr ... eat device to have if you want something convenient to browse the web, read an e-book or even edit Microsoft documents with. The already installed Polaris Office allows you to edit Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel documents which I think is a great convenience.
I already plan on getting the keyboard accessory as I will probably make use of the Polaris office software. Editing documents or extensive typing doesn't execute that well on the on-screen keyboard.
Oh, and I also LOVE being able to run an HDMI cable from the tab to my TV to view photos, movies, videos on the TV instead of the tab itself. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:

Cons: Android for Tablets not yet done. Very plastic cheap feel. Awkward to hold.

1) Android tablet specific apps are just not done yet. There are not many apps. At least not compared to the iPad.
2) The feel of this specific tablet is not very satisfying when holding it. It just feels weird in size and in finish. Very "plasticy" and just not quite right.
This tablet has lots of potential. If you can wait a little bit, I would check out the next version of it. And Android for tablets is just still half baked. Not completely done yet. Android for the tablets will be nice.
Maybe Christmas?

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Even though I am still getting to know my transformer, I am very happy with my purchase! I find it very easy to navigate, if you own any type of touch screen smartphone, you'll get it immediately. I found myself debating because of a couple previous negative reviews, but I'm glad i didn't take it to heart. A previous review that stated there wasn't a delete key... WRONG, there is a delete key...its right next to the "m". There isn't a tab key on the on screen keyboard. I Think this is a wonderful tablet for the money, it does everything as fast as the $500+ tablets Ihave experienced. I am looking forward to purchasing the keyboard docking station. I am used to the android keyboard on my phone that automatically spaces after each word, this one does not. This keyboard does have Swy ... pe, but I do not care for it as much (I use Swype on my phone all the time) it just doesn't seem as accurate, but the predictive text is very accurate. I love the android market! The one downfall I have run in to is that some apps are not compatible with this device quite yet. My example: Netflix. I was looking forward to using my tablet for Netflix, but it looks like I'm just going to have to wait for a compatible version to come out. Download time is super fast, I have not had a download take more than 1 minute so far. The screen is very responsive (with both finger and stylus), and the resolution is wonderful. Both the front and rear cameras are ok, nothing fancy. I have not used Skype or any other video chat yet. Some of the photo and video editing apps are fun and entertaining. I like using the Polaris Office, it's not Microsoft Word by any means, but it does what I need it to do. My family and I are a bit rough with our electronic devices (as in they definitely get their use, and go thru some abuse), I would highly recommend a good screen protector and case. I purchased a Zagg invisible shield (in store) and a Gumdrop drop tech case (online). Overall all I wouldn't exchange this table ... expand » « collapse

Okay this is not a review to bash this product but it is a review to tell you what I personally experienced with the Asus transformer. I purchased this originally as you can tell at best buy since I received and email asking me to review the product to help customers make their decisions.
The reason I chose this purchase was because I wanted to stray away from the ipad and try out android. I've heard so many great things about android. And what did I learn in the end? Well 450 dollars later I ended up realizing that android does have fanboys just like apple. Its like comparing a pc to mac, or even a ps3 to xbox 360. By the way I'm anti apple...so this review will be i ... nteresting ...it sure as heck surprised me...
Well the Asus transformer is a good feeling tablet. Its not to small and not to big. It feels good in your hands. The buttons are on the side of the tablet making it easy to get to. The screen is nice, really nice and bright and very responsive to your touch. The sound on the other hand is very low, no matter how high you have the sound. The real cool thing about this tablet is if you have the money you can buy the dock so you can attach a keyboard, and on top of that the keyboard that attaches to the tablet also has a battery. Now the bad thing is that there are reports of battery leaks and issues with the asus battery dock hopefully the come up with a fix. I didnt own a dock but i was originally going to buy one. The tablet on its own looks great and it was running android 3.0 aka honey comb! i did the 3.1 update as soon as i got this. But before the update when i turned it on i started browsing the tablet there was stuttering issues with playing youtube videos (this was before the update) after i did the 3.1 update this was fixed thank god.
Now the appeal of honey comb is great, its my first time to use an android. And ive heard so many great things from android owners. So i expected a lot from this since being an iphone owner (yes i know i hate apple ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Out beats all other tablets hands down!
Item.Review: I've tried other tablets but this Asus is so fast and the wireless works very well. I like the way it responds to movement with in the apps plus the Polaris office is not a full word processor but it's workable for its size, REALLY responsive. The added value comes with an optional mid keyboard that has (2) USB ports so you can add and store even more data or more expanded memory. The tablets battery will last 5-6 hours and if you get the keyboard that will add another 8.5 hours, even more work time, Sweet, Eh? I would give this tablet a 8 out of 10, I never give a 10, got to allow room for improvement, lol. So if your wanting a great internet/ e- mail/ fun media tablet don'shop anymore, just remember to get the keyboard, it just gives you a even more flexability with this tablet. Enjoy it ... , I surely am. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Solid feel, video playback, great gameplay
Cons: Honeycomb issues, sound from speakers
I have had my transformer for a little nearly two weeeks and just thought i would put in a honest review of the tablet that may help those with their decision. For the money, it is very good deal. The battery life is good. i would say on par with the Xoom's battery. The hardware is satisfactory. It is plastic, but it feels solid and the screen is glass just in case you have heard otherwise. As far as weight is concerned, it does not feel heavy at all. 1.5 lbs is not that heavy, folks, and it is well balanced. The screen is pretty sharp. The auto brightness feature does not do it justice sometimes so sometimes i have to manually set the brightness, but overall I'm satisfied with the sc ... reen. Video playback is pretty good. This thing plays 1080p video with ease. The only real hardware complaint I have is the speakers. They just don't produce sound equivalent to other devices. It is not a huge turn off though and I use my headphones most of the tiime anyway. I believe I got great hardware for what I paid. My biggest complaint is with Honeycomb and I think that is going to be the biggest factor amongst all these Android tablets. Honeycomb will let you down. Just be prepared for it. Apps will freeze on you. The keyboard will not pop when you click in a text input box. The pinch to zoom feature will not be consistent across all applications. Apps will suddenly shut down on you. You'll begin to wonder if you made the right choice. Straight up...Honeycomb has a way to go before it really becomes a robust, solid OS. Your experience may vary, but I owned a Xoom before this tab and returned because I felt for the experience I got with Xoom it was overpriced and I was right. The Xoom exhibited the same behavi with Honeycomb. By the way, these little flaws are not all the time. Just every now and then...just really annoying when they do happen. I hope this review helps someone. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: simple set-up, good price, Excellent design, great battery life,
Cons: absolutely nothing at this point.
I'll get straight to the point. When comparing other tablets to this such as the Galaxy tab 10.1, HTC Flyer, iPad, and others like it, you see the same trend. You wind up paying at least 100 dollars more for the same or less features if you go with the competition(200+ if you go for even the lowest model iPad which isn't even user expandable). In my opinion the 16gb transformer tablet gives you the best possible value for what you spend on it. Even comparing this with the 32gb model, all you really need to do is get the 16gb tablet with a 16gb microSD card and you basically have the same storage space for about 50 bucks less than the 32gb model. not to say that the o ... thers don't interest me. But, at this point, I just want the best value for my money. So, when shopping around for a tablet, ask yourself this: Why pay more for less? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I am truly amazed by this device, I have been anticipating its arrival in the US market months before its official release date. I came really close to purchasing the Motorolla xoom but I really could not justify paying anything more than 400 bucks for any tablet device. I was surprised to discover that the graphics on the ASUS was slightly better than the XOOM, images were crisper. Sound on the other hand was better on the Motorolla XOOM. The ASUS transformer is light and has a sleek design. Plus the keyboard dock option is definitely appealed to me.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I purchased the 16GB eee Transformer as a replacement for my netbook. I can't say that I'm at all disappointed. The interface is easy to use and responsive and the battery life is great - especially with the keyboard dock. Given that the device does not have any onboard USB ports, the dock is a must-have accessory if you plan on using any external drives. The camera takes sharp pictures and video, and the bundled media streaming app is great if you already have a DNLA / uPnP devices. Also, the WiFi range is pretty good - I found myself getting consistently better reception than on my laptop or phone. I was a little disappointed with the speakers however; the volume, especially when using Google Talk video chat sometimes makes it difficult to hear the other person.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: There is no better value in tablets today
Item.Review:
Pros: Price/Performance, Innovative Design
Cons: uhhh - how hard it and the keyboard docks are to find for the first month after launch?
And yes, I'm talking about iPads. An OS written for a tablet and giving all the power of a desktop in a fast and slick interface. Hardware performance and design that is both innovative and practical. I love consuming media on this device and using it as a tablet, but being able to whip out the keyboard that allows it to be effectively used for editing documents and spreadsheets while allowing you to work/play for 16 hours makes it unbeatable.
As others have mentioned, about the only thing (other than 3/4g wireless) that it is missing to match or surpass all other tablets is a led flash on the back facing caamera. And at this price, w ... hy would you even look elsewhere for a wi-fi tablet? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Short story: I didn't know what to expect with the new Andoid/Arm tablet but figured it was worth [$] to give it a shot. Oh my gosh, it is awesome. The Asus is the one to get: every possible feature and oddly the lowest price for a Honeycomb thus far.The day it arrived, I got home from work and unpacked it and my 11 year old and 9 year old grabbed it immediately. The 11 year old loaded the kindle app and bought a book. The 9 year old loaded a free game he has played before and bottom line I didn't touch the thing until they went to bed 3 hours later. I had home and work email on it almost immediately along with a dozen very cool apps.Pros:- Honeycomb (Android 3.0): like no operating system you've ever seen; slick, cool, responsive, flexible and powerful. Well done Google.- Battery li ... fe: they say 8 hours, I figure at least that. Nice job NVIDIA.- Apps & user interface: addicting.- Screen: beautiful and very responsive to touch- GPS: must see to believe. Google maps overlays the sattelite images and even rotates the display on the 3D Z-axis depending on how you orient the tablet. When you arrive at the destination it displays a full screen image of the house from Google street view. Amazing.- Price: Lowest priced Honeycomb tablet on the market.- Warm-up time from sleep: about 2 seconds, including accessing the WiFi network. Great for the occasional quick check of something on the internet without booting up a computer.- Overall use cases are plentiful. I brought it to work and probably sold a half dozen of them in the first 2 days via impromptu 30 second hallway demos.Cons:- length of charging cord. Honestly, that's the only negative I found.I think overall these things are going to explode because they are so versatile and the use cases are plentiful. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: It does what it is intended to do - internet, apps
Cons: Heavy, can be buggy
I have wanted an adroid tablet computer for quite some time. Who wants to carry around a lap top these days and let's face it, a smart phone can't do everything you need it to very quickly. Plus you look like a Star Trek officer with a tablet. What's to lose?
In reality I wanted a tablet that did a few simple things: 1. Allow me to surf the internet without the slowness of a smart phone 2. Allow me to take notes at a meeting 3. Allow me to schedule and manage clients for my business 4. Skype 5. Angry Birds (this is essential) 6. Not be junk
So I pondered many websites for reviews and came to the Asus Transformer TF101 back in October 2011. $399.99.
PROS ... >1. It does all that stuff above 2. It has a docking station that I've yet to buy but looks pretty rad 3. The battery does fairly well. I usually get two days or more of it just sitting around 4. I've dropped it off the couch and have spilled water on it and it still works. 5. It's pretty fast. Faster than I expected (please, have you used early E readers? Yikes.)
CONS 1. The charger is this weird prong thing into this box. Sometimes it disconnects and won't charge which makes you think you're crazy. Don't bother calling support, they aren't helpful. Take the charger apart, move the prongs, do a rain dance and you're good to go. 2. Buggy at times. This is probably Android's problem. Restart and it's fine 3. Power button may have failed. It's plastic. What else is new? 4. The size. Try finding a cute case for this item and call me. I'm still searching!!!!!
WAS IT WORTH IT? Yes.
A WORD OF ADVICE FOR TABLET SEARCHERS No tablet, at this juncture, will replace a laptop no matter what you are told. A laptop is your work horse. You write your dissertation, you do photoshop, you manage your website. You play angry birds, schedule dinner , take some quick notes at work and avoid talking with your family with your tablet. Until these things have better processors, that's what they are good for.
IS THIS AN EQUAL ALTERNATI ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: A great product if you can get it to charge
Item.Review:
Pros: It's light weight. Runs the android Operating System. Easy to use.
Cons: Asus still has not corrected the issue of it not charging after several months
My wife did a lot of research before deciding on which tablet to purchase. She was so excited when she finally made a decision and found a Transformer available at Best Buy, She had noted that many people were complaining on the internet about the device losing the ability to charge for some odd reason. Many of the complaints on the charging issue date back to May of 2011 and forward. There may have been some even further back but I am not sure. She talked with the Best Buy technician on the matter and decided to purchase the device. She got home and loved it. Now... three or four days after the purchase she is on her wa ... y back to Best Buy as the blasted thing wont charge... I can only give this device a two star rating at most because of the frustration of having to go all the way back to Best Buy and trade it for another one with the hopes that one will will not have similar problems. A person would think that Asus would have corrected this issue since it has been occuring for a year now. Two things in the shoddy workmanship of the Wall Plug. First, the pins do not always connect when the pieces snap together and Second, they appear to have installed a sub-standard shoddy thermal breaker in the charging unit. These two conclusions are based on research and solutions offered by Asus support and other non-affiliated forums. This is a minor issue for Asus to correct but a MAJOR issue for end users. If the tablet had not been so easy for my wife to pick up on its use, the review would have been a single star instead of two. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Great tablet, no issues so far
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy file storage and transfer system through MyCloud
Cons: Nothing
Being an "anti-apple" person I was looking for a tablet that was not an Ipad. I already have a droid system phone so the android system seemed like the easiest transition. I researched and read several reviews on different sites and finally settled on the Asus Tablet. A couple of reasons this one swayed me - based on the reviews, this one had the least amount of complaints and many of the complaints were things I wasn't concerned with. Other reasons were the specifications - the external storage - Micro-SD card was a big thing, that gives me the ability to store more or transfer if I need to. The ability to switch at ease from wi-fi to hotspot internet service, the battery life, and the use of the adobe ... flash system. The "my cloud" is awesome - it's not the easiest but not the hardest thing to set up- pretty much makes it unnecessary for external storage for transfer reasons -but the card is still nice for extra space. I can access my personal desktop or laptop remotely - very cool (you have to have the programs set up on both before you can do this, again not the easiest thing, but not the hardest). I have had absolutely no issues with wi-fi or hotspot connections and my screen flips around just fine. Now you do have to go into settings when you first get it and configure it for auto-switch, if not it won't flip around on its own (that took me a few minutes to figure out). If you are already using a droid system phone through google, all your apps transfer onto your tablet - I thought that was great! It cut out having to download them all again. You just have to have a little patience to get it all set up and some time to play with it to figure it out. I had to make a few internet searches and download the manual to assist but so far everything is working perfectly! It is very quick with processing requests as well. One touch of the screen and it is already working to do what you want it to. Sound quality without headphones is as you would expect, I mean my laptop ... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: The Best Android Tablet on the Market
Item.Review: The Transformer is my forth Android tablet. I started with Archos 7 inch, moved to 10.1 inch from Viewsonic, then to a Toshiba and then found my way to the ASUS Transformer. One thing that I noticed about the other three companies is their lack of after sale support for their tablet products. ASUS on the other hand has continued to support their products even after they have been replaced with newer products. Case in point this Transformer has been updated with ICS (Android 4.03) just this month. This has moved this 2011 product to the front of the pack of all Android tablets currently on the market. The flexibility of the product line with it's built-in SD card support, HDMI, port and the accessory keyboard, sdcard adapter and USB adapter are without equal in the market. Other high ... -end features such as Gorilla Glass, quality construction, excellent battery life help place this unit at the top of stack. I have compared the performance of this unit to Apple's iPad 2 and frankly after the upgrade to ICS and subsequent update last week I can say the ASUS blows the socks off the iPad. I use this tablet so much that I actually have sold my Macbook Pro, as it just sat there idle. The customization available with in the Android OS makes this the perfect tool for organizing your mobile computing needs. Selecting from the Android market an email client & browser that best fit my needs was a bit of a learning process, but at least the options were there. I currently monitor four email accounts, one being a Microsoft Exchange account for my corporate emails. All four of the accounts, two Gmail, one Yahoo and the aforementioned Exchange accounts were automatically setup by just entering the email account name and password. It couldn't have been easier. I have even found a way to tether my cell phone and it's data plan to the Tablet via WiFi or Bluetooth depending on the phone being used. Why pay for a separate data plan. Heck even Adobe has released a product called PS Touch that brings many of the features of Photoshop to the Android tablet market. I could not be happier with my choice of the ASUS Transformer and just today ordered the accessory keyboard. I would strongly recommend this tablet to anyone considering the purchase. Don't confuse this with the newer ASUS Transformer Prime that has some issues with wifi, bluetooth and GPS because of it's beautiful yet poor performing case design. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Castrated Android Phone, with no phone:
Item.Review: It is slow, undependable, the touch screen is unresponsive, and sometimes takes 10 taps to respond for a single letter tap. The side of the screen has started going black after 2 months. The Asus crashes constantly, has no provision to shut down applications, has a horrid operating system that is unstable and can't perform the simplest tasks. Unless you need the big screen, why carry around this dumb device that is 10 times larger than your cell phone, is less powerful and costs 5 times more? I bought the Asus Transformer Tablet strictly to use as a back up chart plotter. It worked fine at first, as a dumb display. As soon as I allowed Google Android to automatically update the OS: everything that was useful to me, stopped working. The Asus Transformer is now 2 months old, and if ... it gives me much more trouble, it is in the trash. As reported by everyone, the GPS is undependable, and frequently useless, because the idiot designers, put the GPS inside an aluminum case. The buttons are annoying, you can't tell if you are turning it on or off, or putting it in sleep mode. No cursor buttons on the keyboard. Dumber than a toaster! The battery life is about 5 hours of light use, not the 9 hour the Manufacturer claims. The extra keyboard and battery makes it the size of a laptop with 100th the computing power and versatility. If you want to pay a premium price for device that will waste you life, break and crash, has very little power, no versatility and allows the user almost no control. You have found the one. This is a completely castrated little piece of trash, that is not worth your time, money or effort. Buy a cell phone, and you can do exactly the same things, plus you have a phone, and it fits in your pocket. Or buy a computer, and you can choose and control your applications, like an intelligent person. or buy a dumb e-ink reader for 1/4th the price, and you can read great books with 10 times the contrast in full daylight, while the Transformer is completely washed out and unreadable. The hardware is poor. The OS is pathetic. The combination is the worst of all worlds. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, Speed, Android
Cons: Initial Learning Curve
After reading many of these negative reviews, I'm sort of left scratching my head.
Many of the stated problems (like the cursor jumping when typing, or typing lag in browser, or ICS not updating OTA) are easily solved by:
A. Pressing the "disable cursor pad" button on the keyboard. B. Switching to a different browser. C. Reading that ASUS pulled the OTA ICS update for a short while (it's back now) and no tablets were updating (although you could still do it manually). The reviewer even returned his tablet believing it a defect..
Those are just some examples...
Anyway, personally as a returning student, this tablet suites my needs incredibly well.
I can do word processing/power poi ... nts on the tablet itself , however the option to remote access my PC (or use OnLive Desktop - Look it up!) are very handy if more processing power/full software features are needed.
I've fallen into the routine of having all the power points stored internally, and being able to undock the keyboard and relax on the couch after work and study with just the tablet is incredibly nice. I can even be in the middle of a powerpoint slide, and switch to a word processing app to take notes very easily.
The camera has been very handy in that I've taken pictures of each page of the chapters we're working in, and now have a very clear copy stored in the tablet.
Flash + the keyboard dock are what round out the tablet and where it beats every other tablet currently available (for my needs anyway).
Considerations would be - if you're primarily interested in games, get a quadcore. Same for if you plan to use lots of (probably buggy) live wallpapers or have walls full of flashy widgets. If you need to take detailed notes with a stylus, get a tablet geared towards that. This tablet is geared towards word processing and typing. There are apps for taking notes with your finger/stylus, but it's not as intuitive and glossy as tablets geared specifically for it.
Also be prepared to remote access your PC ... expand » « collapse
