Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast and easy to use.
Cons: The buttons on the side need to work. All of them!
I like this tablet. Don't get me wrong. It does nice things. For such a nice device you would think ASUS would get a fundamental such as the power and volume buttons right. The buttons are loose and one of them didn't even work in my case. I am taking it back and I'm not sure if it will be exchanged or if I will ask for a refund just yet.
Leaving that out, I must say that having it for 24 hours was nice. It upgraded to 4.03 over the air after the first time I powered it up and everything went smoothly. I installed several apps and they all worked flawlessly. It even worked with PS3 media server which allowed me to play my entire Itunes library over the WI-FI.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I use the Asus transformer like a netbook, and it has worked great so far (2 wks). It is fast and has great battery life. One drawback may be the slightly small keys (especially the shift key for your right hand). I do love having the attached keyboard for typing. Also the trackpad is difficult to use, but just touching the screen quickly makes it easy to navigate.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Use to read books; surf web; handle email; watch movies; excellent battery life; charges fast; I would recommend to everyone. Sound is sometimes not loud enough.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Exactly what I was looking for in a tablet
Item.Review:
Pros: ASUS updates are regular, automatic, and quick. Tons of apps.
Cons: Could be brighter in sunlight outdoors, not easy to connect to my home network.
If you are looking for a keyboard or word processing get a real laptop computer. If you are looking for portablility, tons of free apps, and great color this is the system for you. It has a great camera front and back, quick on the internet, more free apps then I can shake a stick at, great color and screen, fast, long battery life, and the list goes on. Get the 16 gig unit because you can double that size by buying the memory card on line for it cheap. Can connect to my HDTV via cable.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: processor, graphics
Cons: camera, speaker little low
The tablet has a fast processer, clear graphics and stacks up to Ipad 2 plus it's android. The only downside is the 5mp camera that's grainy photos and video which is a shame because the tablet itself can handle HD video but since I rarely use the camera (have a dedicated pocket cam) I'm not concerned but had to hold off a star.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: memory flexibility
Cons: nothing yet....
I spent many months visiting Best Buy and asking questions before deciding to buy this particular tablet. It had a better price than the others, more flexibility (sd card), great battery life and with Best Buy Support products I think it was the best deal in town. I love my tablet, and I am using it daily. I use it in my classroom and on the road. Highly recommended, but buy it at best buy for the best buy.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I use this tablet at work to stream music the most and I also check email and surf the web. It is fast and convenient and weighs so much less than the laptop I was lugging around. That's what I enjoy the most is it's lighweight. The viewing area is also plenty big. The battery life is GREAT and much better than a laptop.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: good price, expandable memory, HDMI!
Cons: no camera flash, battery life could be better.
i have been using this tablet for over a month now and this is pretty fantastic. I have been using this tablet for work and at home. The battery life is not bad but could be better. I use wifi all day long and i get about 8 hours of use. I have used the HDMI to watch movies at home and the quality is very good. I can watch just about any format, but have had to download an app to watch all. Surprisingly the camera functions really well and have taken quite a few pictures. Only downside is no flash, but in lighted situations it works great. I have not played with the video function of it so cannot say how good or bad creating videos are. Overall i have been very pleased wit ... h the functionality and being able to use it at home and at work. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
Item.Review: I love this tablet. It works just like my phone. Does anything your phone will but call out (unless you're on Skype with wireless). Thin, lightweight, easy to use. It has Adobe Flash, HDMI, lots of storage, takes a micro SD card for memory expansion, and lots of free android apps. It is great for movies. The battery life is incredible.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable, lightweight.
Cons: nothing.
Love the Android OS on this table. It's sleek design and brown color makes it different than most other tablets. I use this for work and personal. The keyboard on the tablet for typing is awesome, so fast and responsive. I also download E-Books and the pages and pictures are so clear to read. I'm so glad I got this tablet. I was debating on the 16G or 32G. If you download alot of music or movies I would go with the 32G. But this tablet is awesome!!

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: USB Charger Broke within 2 weeks of use
Item.Review:
Pros: Great graphics
Cons: USB Cable
Overall I'm very happy with the quality and functionality of this tablet. However, the USB charger has broken (parts remain in the tablet).

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: size and easy of use, espeically for skype
Cons: espn app does not rotate
easy to use, nice option, especially with the keyboard attachment. The attachment makes it easy for my wife to use.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I returned my Vizio tablet and bought Asus eepad, I am really happy with it, it`s light and thin and fast, screen size is just right, I use it mainly for email,browsing,netflix and skype with mini hdmi cable, the screen is very clear, cameras are a bit grainy but overall pretty good for skype. Only gripe I have is with the speakers, not loud enough and very tinny. But overall I am happy with the product. I use it to rdp to my desktop, the bluethooth mouse connected without any flaw and is a must for rdp sessions and netflix when connected to my tv. Netflix on my tv with hdmi connection is really good, vibrant colors and no lags. Battery is amazing, charges very fast and lasts over 8 hours

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I love being able to watch TV/ movies where ever I am. Hope to be able to use the HTML connection with my TV. It is light, easy to use, and the battery is quite adequate.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use.
Cons: Haven't found anything yet.
I haven't gotten to use the tablet a lot yet but what I've done on it has been very easy to use and set up applications. What I also like about it is you can start out with a lower memory such as 16G and can update it to 32 by buying a card when or if you want to. It's very portable and fairly light weight.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: This tablet has everything I was looking for. Large HD display size, lots of speed, expansion slot (micro sd) and HDMI, long battery life. I am very happy with the purchase and highly recommend ASUS.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Right out of the box..Has it all.
Item.Review: Much more than I expected. Clear colors, great resolution and so easy to use. I have found it great to keep handy so I can get on my PC desktop from anywhere in the house. Or if I want to check something out on web or check my email the pre-loaded browser works great. I also download ebooks from my local library. The back camera with it's 5mp takes great photos. The only downside I have found is I wish droid had made it easier to exchange files with windows.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: This tablet has all the whistles and bells anyone could want. The battery life is great. Right after using the operating system updated twice straight from ASUS which normally as the user, you have to search out updates and manually load yourself. The sound from the speaker is good although I would not rely on it for stereo quality sound. I like the front and rear camera. My primary use so far has been reading free downloaded books. Screen color is excellent. I have found that if the screen gets too dirty, from finger prints the screen can become less responsive. I typically clean the screen after so many uses to improve touch commands and to just remove all the finger print trails. I am not sure at this time if a screen protector would help. I find it cheaper to just clean the screen rat ... her than pop for another $30 accessory. Lastly for the money, the unit came with 16 Gb of memory which for the price of other units, you get 8 Gb. Top this off with the great deal from BH makes this a winner. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I bought this tablet for my wife to surf the internet rather than dragging out the old, heat bomb laptop. It is easy to use, fast, and has very good battery life. It's our first tablet and I couldn't be happier. I bought a mini-HDMI to HDMI cord as well and have hooked it up to the LCD to watch streaming videos. THRILLED!!

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: What an Amazing Tablet! iPad2 Competitor
Item.Review: I bought this for my parents for Xmas and I can honestly say I wish I had bought one for myself aswell. The display projects amazingly crisp images and tones. The camera's are alright, nothing special. Honeycomb Is very intuitive and more customizable then it's leading competitor iOS5. The marketplace has been rapidly growing and has almost an identical lineup of top apps in the AppStore. The build quality is great. I give the build quality a solid B+, the left edge of mine seems loose but it is nothing to complain about. Being able to expand memory at your discretion is definitely a selling point. Today you can buy memory, such as micro SD ect. for pennies on the dollar and the higher GB IPads will cost you an arm and a leg. What more can you ask for

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Battery life, size, features
Had for about 2 months now. It is one of the best looking and performing piece of electronic equipment i've owned. Easy setup with a long battery life, added on the docking station and it excells even more. The touch screen works great with a stylus and the size of the screen is perfect. The keyboard is an extra bonus with the added features of the docking station, usb ports, sd card access makes this extremely versatile. Speed is extremely quick compaired to netbooks and the droid system so far has not presented any problems.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Maybe the extra ports, but I haven't really used them.
Cons: Battery life, lack of tablet software, no update to the latest Android software yet, poor usability
I bought this and an iPad 2 at the same time for work. This is like the Frankenstein vs a person. It is sluggish, entering the screen unlock PIN number rarely takes the first number and I still can not update it to the latest Android OS. The widescreen seems to make it worse as most things do not understand the wider screen. Finding actual tablet software vs phone software is a bit of a challenge as well.
Basically, I would use an iPad where the Asus Transformer just sits on the charger. It rarely seems to last 5 days off the charger with no use and has actually drained the battery completely overnight. O ... bviously something was running in the background, but I have no idea what it was (or why the OS would go to sleep and leave a process running hot like that).
Anyway, if you want a tablet you might use, I would save a few extra dollars and get the iPad 2. When I bought both, these devices were the same price, and that is completely unacceptable. I could see this being nice for kids at about $150. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: fast, versatile
Cons: sound volume
I am very pleased with this tablet! Had it for three weeks and the battery last me all day. Had the usual issues with some force closing of some applications but it is expected with android system. Hasn't frozen on me at all. FAST ALSO!!! Like the chance of having a keyboard with xtra battery. Would really recommend! Sound is a little low but great on headphones.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Portable; Great for home or outside; Engaging; Fun; Durable; Versatile; Attractive Design; Easy to Use
Cons: none
The Asus FT101 is great. Small enough for light office and lounge chair gaming, to rugged outdoors. It is fast, responsive, and a brilliant display. I like the versatility, durability, and is upgradable. Nothing left to say but a wonderful and affordable device.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Bought during black friday and also picked up the docking station/keyboard. I have had several tablets and this is by far the best in terms of battery life, expansion ports, speed and screen. Very stable and loads all apps/games. Wish I bought another at black friday price.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Fast, long battery life, good looking.
Cons: Haven't discovered anything significant.
After many hours of online research over several months and hands-on experience with a range of Android tablets and the iPad, this was my pick for two reasons: the interface is smooth and fast, and the custom keyboard dock puts it in a different league from the rest in terms of connectivity and convenience.
My main purpose in buying a tablet was for testing ePub and Kindle editions (among other things, I design and typeset books) and to run the Adobe Touch applications recently released for designers, so I'm perhaps not a usual tablet buyer. It was a bonus that a tablet would provide a convenient way to carry and present a portfolio to potential new clients.
The Transform ... er has exceeded my expectations for ease of use, reliability, picture quality and all around usefulness. It handles video and video conferencing (via Skype, WebEx, etc.) with aplomb, runs professional apps very smoothly, and physically it handles well and feels solid.
Where the device really stands out among the pack is the custom keyboard dock. Not only does it provide extended battery life and a nice-to-use keyboard, it also provides two full-size USB ports, adds a full SD card slot and turns the tablet into a perfectly portable clamshell package.
As a designer, I appreciate the fact that the screen is in Golden Ratio. This is not only attractive, it is a practical format for reading, modern HD video, and for displaying photographs and graphic layouts (wide billboards, magazine layouts, and so on).
It didn't hurt a bit that, for about what I'd have paid for a Galaxy Tab or an iPad, I bought both the 16GB Transformer and the keyboard/dock.. The combination is first class. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Fun; Easy to Use; Portable; Attractive Design
I have not delved into it too much, although the kids seem to be pretty consumed with the apps! Will get into as the kids are asking about setting up accounts for cloud, printing and Amazon App Store.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Kid friendly; Durable; Attractive Design; Portable; Easy to Use
My wife had a Nook Color that was rooted by me to run Android Honeycomb. While the Nook was functional, neither the processor nor the on board memory were sufficient for the OS and apps, and several of them would frequently force close, making for a frustrating experience for both her and my 2 children, both 6 and 3. The Transformer works very well - the imbedded Android OS along with a great proc and memory allows for Netflix streaming, gaming, and basic work with email and some docs as well. For us, this is as functional as an eBook, but far more user friendly with the touch screen interface, and it is frequently used by both children and my wife.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Fun; Easy to Use; Durable
Bought this for my wife as a netbook replacement. She loves the portability and the touch screen. She has downloaded a couple books and games and has run the battery down twice already. No knock on battery life (approx. 9 hours), she just has it on all the time.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Only had it a few days, but I've used an iPad and also have an Evo and iPhone4. I've played with some other friends' tablets too. This tablet is incredible for the price. You get performance, usability, expandability, and great connections. Loving it.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Fun; Portable; Engaging; Attractive Design; Easy to Use
The 2nd one is great. The 1st had to go back in 2 week for a faulty internal charger connection. Can't seem to play flash videos though. Also, it's not always that quick. I also have an ipad2, and the eeepad is not far behind it in my opinion. The apps are more limited, but the [@] and Kindle apps work well. All in all I'm satified with the Asus.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Get two the are small, and fun to use...
Item.Review: Has a good solid feel. Easy to use, and I find it fun to find apps to increase productivity and usability. I believe there is always a right tool for the job. This tablet is the right tool in the workplace, and after work entertainment (video and Internet radio). I would not give this as a gift to the technically challenged. I hate waiting, especially for batteries to charge. Battery life is good, but it feels like forever to get it charged. Was in a pinch one Sunday when we could not print out a script for a Church narrator reading. So I emailed the MS Word doc to myself, opened the attachment, and read directly from the ASUS. It was great; clear text for easy reading. Even passed it to another member so they could read their part. They had never used a tablet before but had not problem ... using the ASUS. All-in-all it was a smart purchase. Buy yours now! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: One of the better android tablets..
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Good Screen Quality; Easy To Read; Long Battery Life; Great Software Bundle; Gorilla glass; Good Compatibility; Attractive Design
Cons: Fingerprint magnet; Heavy
I was looking at tablets to fulfill my need for a device that can give me quick access to the web.. sometimes just to check an email quick.. sometimes to watch a recipe on youtube and sometimes just to surf the web or netflix.. I absolutely hated the booting and loading time of windows laptops and the errors/viruses and other host of issues.. The instant access that the ASUS Transformer gives me to the internet is just what i wanted.. I also have the option to purchase the keyboard to make it a productivity hub.. its got a beautiful screen with gorilla glass that unfortunately is a fingerprint magnet.. ... it is a tad heavy and so needs both hands to hold.. sometimes is a little slippery to hold even with the patterned plastic backside.. performance is super quick.. no issues.. occasional lagging especially when opening up the android store or webpages with a lot of flash.. its got two decent cameras.. some apps didn't work well.. but thats probably an android issue with them working on the newer ics release.. all in all.. this is probably the best value for money android tablet.. esp.. if you get it in the $300 range.. have fun.. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Durable; Good Screen Quality; Compact Design; Long Battery Life
Cons: Limited Storage
Great iPad replacement, not an iPad killer yet. Used product for a week now, speed & quality is almost identical to iPad, but not quite there yet. Great for general use such as games, Internet, and videos. Pleasure to carry around.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Read; Attractive Design; Good Screen Quality; Durable; Good Compatibility; Long Battery Life
This tab strikes a good balance between beauty and practicality. The size is larger than most tabs, which puts some people off at first, but after using it for over a week, I can say that the thicker bezel is actually a positive since it gives you something to hold on to that doesn't actuate the touch screen.
The screen is gorgeous and the battery life is liberating. I'm picking up the keyboard base this weekend, so this review is for tab only.
Rarely (twice now perhaps), I've seen glitches for which I don't know the cause. Once it rebooted itself spontaneously, another time the auto-orientation got confused and kept switching between landscape and portrait regard ... less of what I did. In that case, I had to carefully try to power it off (hit the shutdown confirmation button at JUST the right moment) and restart. Again, not sure if these problems are honeycomb, tegra 2 or asus specific.
Overall, this was totally worthwhile, especially considering the cost came in at ~40% less than a refurbed iPad2 of similar capabilities. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Overall quite pleased. It's an Android tablet, thin and light enough. Good display size and the display works well. Wallwart is small enough, and the blades fold in so it's easy to travel with. Cons: * The charge/sync cable is proprietary, not micro USB; replacements/spares are hard to come by. Like all tablets, requires 2.1A to charge. * Does not present to host computer as a removable drive, but as a specialized device (but no special drivers required).

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I love this device. I go to college online and I am able to do my work on it. I also love the entertainment value that goes with this device. Everything about this tablet works great, the screen, touch control, and the battery life. I also have the docking station which comletes this tablet for me. The keyboard, extra battery time, usb ports, and sd card slot make the docking station more then worth the money.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Good price for what you are getting.
I had an I-pad and took it back because it did not support certain programs. This tablet not only supports most programs,it is easy to use,and has a great screen, tons of apps,and the camera is great also. I love that it also has a separate keyboard which charges the tablet when in use. I am very satisfied with my purchase, also it has an expandable memory.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Good price, Excellent screen and battery
Cons: None so far.
I have been doing research on tablets since several month ago. I was waiting for Transformer Prime, but I saw the Black Friday sale for $249 in Best Buy. This unbeatable price was so attractive, so I decided to try my luck to get one. I stayed on the line for 4 hours and finally got my first tablet. I have used it for almost a week. I think the Transformer TF101 is good enough for me and feel so glad to make this purchase. The screen is awesome and bettery is good. Honeycomb runs very smoothly on it. Have the Amazon app store installed on it and get some paid apps for free. Now I regret that I did not buy the keyboard dock ($99) at the same time.
Overall, this is a cheap, but great tablet.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Everything
Cons: Haven't found anything yet
I bought this for work and love it. It took a little research to get my Office Live email to sync up right, but no problems now. The screen is AMAZING and this thing is lightning fast. The keyboard is an awesome accessory and adds a lot that Apple can't currently match. 16 hours of battery life with the keyboard? I actually hit 18 yesterday and was working on it the entire time. I know everyone compares tablets to the iPad, but I have to say, this thing has the iPad beat hands down for me. I tried every tablet for weeks researching the best one for me, and this is the only one that really impressed me. It is as fast or faster than the iPad 2, and does several things the iPad doesn't, like: - Play Flash content - Last mor ... e than 6 hours on a charge - Have a slot for MicroSD cards to expand memory - Have a micro HDMI slot for video
This thing is a beast and has set the bar very high for Android devices. It comes with a lot that would cost extra to make possible on an iPad (like the HDMI port). All this, and it's more than $100 less expensive than the comparable iPad 2!
Watch out Apple! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use, and has expandable memory, to put movies and music on.
Cons: Hard to turn on, and stuff offered on tablet only tells you if you have a virus. No protection viruses offered for free.
Owned and ipad and didn't like it, too many problems. So, decided to try a different tablet. This is a good tablet, however, it is hard to turn on, so I plug it in, and then unplug it when it's on. Easy to use, and light weight. I really like it, but was disappointed that I was not offered virus protection for it, and was later told after I purchased the asus transformer tablet, that it would cost $20, but if I would have purchased the virus protection at the time of purchase, it would have only been $10. I was not asked about that, so I feel like it wasn't fair. Was also told t ... hat it turns on harder, because of the android. Still like the tablet, just wish they would have been more informative at the store. Great expandability options, which is something the ipad doesnt' have. Have enjoyed using it, but it needs more gaming options for free. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: Great screen and battery life, but a little on the hefty side, you wouldn't want to carry it around all day. Definitely a cost effective alternative to the ipad.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Powerful; Fast; Affordable; Easy To Use
Great tablet regardless of it's price but the fact that it's cheaper than anything else in its league. Not to many accessories available in my region (South Africa) so make sure to get them in the USA. Was pleasantly supprised to find that it has GPS. Did think it would bother me that it doesn't have 3G but it not a must.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Screen and battery life
Cons: The length of the power cord, and lack of accessories
I did months of research before I purchased my TF. I felt like the Ipad was over rated and limited. So I was excited to get the TF with the keyboard to get the 16 hours of battery time. I have been very happy with my TF for the past 6 months, the screen is bright and has nice viewing angles, the battery life is great. My only complaint is the length of the power cord, and the lack of accessories, mainly external speakers. Great product for the price.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Battery, great price
Cons: edges scratch easy
This is a great tablet especially for the price. The battery probably would be able to go up to 8 hours if I didn't watch video on it the whole time i'm using it and that is actually where the problem is, sometimes when your watching video or just surfing the internet it will just close and you lose what ever you were working on.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Great bang for your buck, overall
Item.Review: I use this tablet mostly for entertainment purposes. After downloading a few (necessary) apps from Android Market I was able to reproduce all sorts of video formats. The screen is amazing though the speakers' output is quite mediocre (same with all tablets I've seen so far). Get a good headset for this tablet and you'll be ok. Transformer's dock is a great add-on, higly recommended. Battery life is OK yet could be a little better. Great Google integration (obviously). If you're a google fanboy, like myself, you'll find this tablet very useful to sync and move around your gmail accounts. Haven't used the frontal camera yet, but pics are not this tablet's forte. 4 out of 5. Windows 7 64-bit integration still a little sloppy.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Beautiful Screen, fast, and stable, sounds great, usb connectivity
Cons: Low volume speakers, headphone jack in awkward location, weight is a little high.
This device, coupled with its associated Keyboard Dock, is one of the most powerful portable Android Devices I've seen thus far! Though I wish this came in an 8" Form Factor as well, the 10" screen is gorgeous! While it may suffer a bit from a little light bleed around the edges when screen is black, it's hardly noticeable when I'm looking for it. Your milage may vary on this, however, and most folk I've seen who talk about it are still otherwise very happy with it. The speakers are small but adequate for personal viewing. Headphones are recommended if you need louder or clearer volume. It's nice and zippy, it's fluid ... (Except when loading massive webpages, especially with Flash) and all the sensors work quite well. The cameras on it aren't anything to write home about, but they're sufficiently good that they work with Google Googles quite well. With the associated keyboard dock, I can plug in any and all of my USB hard drives, both external and thumb drives and with the most recent update, USB game controllers too! All in all, instead of buying a Netbook, you might consider getting one of these! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: easy to use, good price
Cons: slightly heavier than other tablets
The Asus EEE Transformer is great. I am not an apple person and found the Asus to be very user-friendly. I use this both for personal and business use. As business, I am able to keep customer lists and product information on it. It has great memory and it makes information very accessible. I have plug this right into my computer and drag files rather than using iTunes as Apple requires – very handy! There are times for work, I have left my laptop behind for a meeting because Asus Transformer does everything for me. I enjoy being able to use the Work, Excel, and PowerPoint!! I have noticed that the apps for Android technology are not up to the same level as Apple, but I am assuming it is coming. As for ... the docking station - highly recommend it. You can use a USP keychain - AWESOME!! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: Most bang for your buck android tablet
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy To Set Up; Easy To Use
Might be a little bit more chunkier than some of the other tablets, but has the same power and is just as fast. Plus with the keyboard dock that extends the battery there's nothing out there that can give you the versatility of the transformer... Well except for maybe the asus slide

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to set up, & has ports
Cons: would like something a little smaller and lighter.
I have tried 4 tablets prior to the Asus Transformer and this is the best of the lot. I've had it for about 6 weeks now and I can't believe how easy & quick it is to download Apps. The new Honey Comb platform is superior to the previous Android system. The print program prints directly to our Envy printer without a hiccup. The display is very sharp and it holds a charge very well. Traveled well on our recent vacation, too. I tried for something a little smaller in between my iTouch and this but settled for this size as it's easier on the eyes.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: The Screen, the ability to expand the memory and price.
Cons: a little heavier then other tablets, speakers are a little weak
I have to say I looked back and forth to all Android tablets. For the price (and even beyond) it is a great tablet. When ever I buy tech the first thing I look at is the support that tech has. Driver, firmware, general software updates are very important.
As soon as I connected the Asus to my network it was updating to the newest droid firmware. (just released less then a week ago). As well coming with a full functional office software as well google talk. (supporting face to face video)
The hardware works great supporting up to 32Gb Micro, with the 5Meg rear cam, and front facing 1.3Meg, works for the video chat, as well the mini H ... DMI (HDMI 1.3) works well.
I bought this for reading PDFs, maps and videos for trips, so battery life is crucial. For the last week I have been getting over 9 hours of constant use every day.
The thing that push this tablet over the edge is the docking station. Not only does it add 2 USB 2.0 ports and another memory card slot (giving you up to 64Gb removable memory) but it has an extra 7 hours of battery life. The best part of that extra battery life is the docking station will charge the tablet even when it is not plugged in. As well it plug/unplugs fast and easy, it also folds over in a clam shell design to protect the tablet screen.
If you are looking for a good tablet, for a great price, get the Asus Eee Pad Transformer TF101 expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: I use the Eee Pad for both personal and work related uses. So far,I am pleased. There are documented problems with light leakage at the edges of the screen, build quality, battery drain, and sound. The XDA site has the details for these problems, but I am thankful to say that upon checking my tablet and the docking station, none of these issues exist for me. I had done my homework and knew this was the tablet I needed. The overriding factor is the 16 hours of battery life with the docking keyboard attached. I need the keyboard for business use and the battery power means I can be completely mobile for whole day/night. The IPS screen technology is great and better than other comparatively priced tablets. I'm very happy with my purchase. I purchased on 9/2/11 and my model number is ... in the B7O run. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.ReviewTitle: ASUS ePad - Great display and touch functionality
Item.Review:
Pros: Awesome display
Cons: All good news with this product.
The ASUS epad is a great product at a great price point. The display is bright with rich color. The touch functionality works as expected. Nice on screen keyboard. We have 6 units used for survey collections and we are very pleased with web browser and wireless connectivity.
One of the units is a little slow to power up. Maybe something with the power switch. One unit also had a problem where it would not unlock and we had to drain the battery to re-cycle the unit. After recharging the unit was fine.
Overall we are very pleased with the ASUS ePad and price point. We would definitely buy more when the need arrises.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review: This is a great tablet and an amazing value for the price. The display is bright, clear and sharp and the Android system gives you lots of apps to choose from. I also have the keyboard/docking station, which makes it even better. Once docked, it looks and acts just like a netbook. The docking station also increases battery life to 16 hours - and also adds 2 USB ports and a second SD card reader. Bst purchase I've made in a long time. ...

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: Beautiful screen and fast performance
Cons: Camera quality
This tablet is super quick with all the tablet bells and whistles. It has a strong gorilla glass screen and is relatively thin with both front an rear facing cameras. I especially like the micro sd card slot for memory expansion. This is a wifi only tablet so there is no contract to hassle with. Battery life gets me through a full day of moderate use with some power left over.

Item.Item: ASUS Eee Pad Transformer TF101 16 GB - Espresso
Item.Review:
Pros: size, weight and android operating system
Excellent display, good sound. Adequate storage (16GByte). Has all the advantages of Android operating system, with it's endless apps. Disadvantages, not easy to move apps and data to the SD card. The word processor seems to use it as a default, but I have been unable to move anything to it. Still new to me and I may figure it out. I still highly recommend this if you want a tablet.
